title: [ExecContainer] exec can now return stdout and stderr #50
body:
Pull request for #50
I choose to create a Tty object which contains stdout and stderr Strings.
I think very big output can be problematic. 
Is it good for you ?

title: Added support for setting a restart policy on a container
body: Note that this requires support for specifying non-string values in container options, since the maximum retry count is an integer.

title: The transport extracts a message from the response JSON if possible
body: If the HTTP response contains a JSON object with a "message" member, this is extracted as the error message in place of the default string.

title: Add support for setting the log driver for a container
body: The log driver setting has a 3-level nested structure (`HostConfig.LogConfig.Type`) so I implemented a recursive function for mapping key names to JSON to replace the old special case for `HostConfig`.

title: Make rep-types clonable
body:
While using this library I needed one of the types to derive from `Clone`, so I made all of them clonable.

I'm fairly new to Rust, so let me know if this is not desired.

title: doc: expose comment as API doc
doc: fix markup so text does not render as one sentence
[Docker Host] Support for non-https remote API
body: Use shiplift with insecure docker remote API

title: Store Cow<str> instead of &str
body:
Currently structures store a raw str slice, which makes for poor API ergonomics. By storing a `Cow<str>`, the struct can outlive the stack data if necessary.

I discovered the downside of the current API, which I queried here: https://users.rust-lang.org/t/binding-does-not-live-long-enough-even-though-its-being-returned/9002

Also, this is a good article on the topic, if you're interested: http://blog.jwilm.io/from-str-to-cow/

Btw, I also snuck in a commit to squash some warnings that were getting annoying!

title: Fixed bug where `Images::build` panics on "status" replies
body: I came across this bug when trying to build an image which relies on a repository that doesn't exist locally. The Docker API replies with "status" messages for downloading/extracting the base image.

title: update to hyper v0.10 with separate openssl dependency
body:
Hi,

This PR updates the `hyper` crate to `v0.10` which removes the dependency to `openssl`. TLS support is added through the `hyper-openssl` crate.

This depends on https://github.com/softprops/hyperlocal/pull/5 which also updates `hyperlocal` to `v0.10` to avoid a clash with `openssl-sys` versions.

Some context here: https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/985

Signed-off-by: Alexandre Beslic <abeslic@abronan.com>

title: Add support for Devices
OnBuild option is an array now.
Add CapAdd to ContainerOptionsBuilder
body: Allows for creating `ContainerOptions` that extend additional privileges to the container.

title: Update hyper to 0.9 (fix #13)
body: This seems to work with a Unix socket. I have not tested this with HTTP as I don't have such setup available at the moment. If you do not have such setup yourself then I'll please tell me and I'll create one for testing.

title: Implement the standard Error trait
body:
Implementing the standard Error trait allow composing the library error together
with frameworks such as error-chain

title: Set the Host header
body:
It is currently impossible to create new container. This patch resolves this
issue. See the following link for details:

https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/20865

title: Make id and status optional for events
body: "id" and "status" are not present in network events. At the future I might create a pull request that adds support for different types of events, but at the moment this patch prevents the library from panicking when receiving a network event.
